title: Zhenkun Li
text: Researcher Department of Civil Engineering Aalto University, Finland.

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
Research Interests
Structural Health Monitoring (SHM)
Damage detection, Model updating, modal identification.
Vehicle-bridge Interaction (VBI)
Vehicle scanning method, Weigh-in-motion (WIM), Vehicular parameter identification, Road roughness estimation.
Machine Learning
Bayesian statistics, Gaussian processes, Deep learning, Computer vision, Transfer learning, Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs).

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
News and updates

September 18, 2023. The paper “Bridge Frequency Identification in City Bus Monitoring: A Coherence-PPI Algorithm”(link will be soon available) authored by Yifu Lan, myself, Keijo Koski, Ludovic Fülöp, Timo Tirkkonen and Weiwei Lin is accepted by Engineering Structures. Congrats to Yifu!
July 21, 2023. Together with Dr. Mario Puppio, Dr. Marco Tanganelli, and Dr. Filippo Landi, we are managing a special issue entitled “Evaluation of Buildings’ and Infrastructures’ Performance and Analysis of Seismic and Naturally Induced Disasters” in the journal of Applied Sciences (IF=2.7). Research on new design strategies, modern architectural and structural concepts for the new structures, machine learning, innovation in material technology or construction chain, or the retrofit of the ancient and traditional structures will be considered for publication.
July 20, 2023. The paper “High-Fidelity Time-Series Data Synthesis based on Finite Element Simulation and Data Space Mapping” authored by Youqi Zhang, myself, Rui Hao, Weiwei Lin, Lingfang Li and Di Su is accepted by Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing. In this paper, I was responsible for Finite Element Modeling using Abaqus driven by Python. One interested in this paper can find its preprint version in Publications.
July 2-6, 2023. I am attending IALCCE 2023 in Milano, Italy. More pictures can be found HERE. Thanks, all friends, for the interesting topics and nice dinner.
June 15, 2023. My paper “Bridge Frequency Scanning Using the Contact-Point Response of an Instrumented 3D Vehicle: Theory and Numerical Simulation” co-authored with Weiwei Lin and Youqi Zhang is accepted by Structural Control and Health Monitoring.
June 8, 2023. My paper “Indirect damage identification for bridges using passing and temporarily parked vehicles” co-authored with Yifu Lan and Weiwei Lin is accepted by Engineering Structures.
April 6, 2023. Zhenkun Li was awarded an incentive grant in Fabian and Jaakko Ahvenainen Foundation grants awarded for the year 2022.

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
Research purposes



Our infrastructures, especially bridges, were built in the last century and are prone to deterioration and exposed to environmental hazards. My research aims to monitor the health conditions of infrastructures via system identification, uncertainty quantification, interaction between bridges and vehicles, and the cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques. If you are interested in my background and intend to cooperate with me, please contact me at zhenkun.li@aalto.fi.

title: About me
text:
If you are interested in structural health monitoring (SHM), vehicle-bridge interaction (VBI), and machine learning, and intend to cooperate with me, please contact me at zhenkun.li@aalto.fi.

Zhenkun Li is a Researcher at the Department of Civil Engineering at Aalto University. He received his M.Eng. in School of Civil Engineering from Dalian University of Technology, China. His research interests lie in the Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) for civil infrastructure systems, damage detection, finite element analysis, deep learning and computer vision.

Prof.Łukasz Jankowski, Friends, and me.

Main teacher: Weiwei Lin
Teaching Assistant: Zhenkun Li

Description
It is common for organizations to collect huge amounts of data over time, and existing time series analysis tools are not always suitable to handle the scale, frequency and structure of the data collected. In this workshop, we will look at some packages and methods that have been developed to handle the analysis of large collections of time series.
Day 1: We look at the tsibble data structure for flexibly managing collections of related time series. We look at how to do data wrangling, data visualizations and exploratory data analysis. We explore feature-based methods to explore time series data in high dimensions. A similar feature-based approach can be used to identify anomalous time series within a collection of time series, or to cluster or classify time series. Primary packages for day 1 are tsibble, lubridate and feasts (along with the tidyverse of course).
Day 2 is about forecasting. We look at some classical time series models and how they are automated in the fable package, and we will explore the creation of ensemble forecasts and hybrid forecasts. Best practices for evaluating forecast accuracy will also be covered. Finally, we will look at forecast reconciliation, allowing millions of time series to be forecast in a relatively short time while accounting for constraints on how the series are related.

title: ETC3550: Applied Forecasting for Business and Economics
text:
Audience
This course is for you if you:

already use the tidyverse packages in R such as dplyr, tidyr, tibble and ggplot2;
need to analyze large collections of related time series; and
would like to learn how to use some tidy tools for time series analysis including visualization, decomposition and forecasting.

section: CIV-E2040 - Maintenance and Repair of Structures D, Lecture, 24.10.2022-8.12.2022
text:
CIV-E2040 - Maintenance and Repair of Structures D, Lecture, 24.10.2022-8.12.2022
Main teacher: Weiwei Lin
Teaching Assistant: Zhenkun Li
The course offers a deeper level of learning about maintenance, repair, and residual service life evaluation of structures. The course covers (i) maintenance of structures, (ii) demolition and strengthening of structures, (iii) corrosion protection of reinforced concrete structures, (iv) repair methods for concrete and rendered structures, (v) repair of building service systems, (vi) repair of moisture and microbial deterioration, and (vii) analysis and evaluation of the residual service life of structures. Core content analysis is presented in Table 1. The course contains (i) activating teaching lectures that are introductory lectures related to different areas of the repair of structures, and (ii) the course assignment that is based on an existing repair project (real case). The assignment report will describe the sustainable repair measures of the case study.

Main teacher: Weiwei Lin
Teaching Assistant: Zhenkun Li
